Okay, so I'm trying to figure out whether you can only see hippopotamuses in Africa. I know that hippos are big animals, but I'm not exactly sure about their range. I've heard they live in rivers or lakes, but I'm not certain where exactly.

First, I remember that hippos are semi-aquatic, so they need water to survive. They spend a lot of time in water to keep cool, especially during the day. Africa is a continent with many large rivers and lakes, so it makes sense that they're found there. But are they only in Africa?

I think I've heard that some zoos have hippos, but those are probably not wild ones. So in the wild, are there any other places besides Africa? I'm trying to recall if any other countries have wild hippos. Maybe some parts of Asia or Europe? I'm not sure. I don't remember seeing any in Asia, but I'm not certain.

Wait, I think I heard something about hippopotamuses being introduced to other places. Wasn't there a place in South America where they were released? Or maybe in the US? I'm not sure. I think Florida had some invasive species, but I don't know if hippos are among them. That might be a myth or a movie thing.

Let me think about their natural habitat. They need warm climates because they don't have much body fat and can't regulate their body temperature easily. So they're probably found in regions that are warm, which would include parts of Africa, but maybe also other tropical areas.

I also remember that hippos have a specific diet, mostly grass, which they graze on at night. They come out of the water at dusk and dawn to feed. So the areas they live in need to have enough grassland near water sources.

I'm trying to remember if any other countries have wild populations. I think in the past, hippos were more widespread, but due to habitat loss and hunting, their range has shrunk. So maybe now they're only found in certain parts of Africa.

Wait, I think there was a population in ancient Egypt, but that's a long time ago. Now, I'm not sure if they exist outside of Africa. Maybe some conservation efforts have reintroduced them to other areas, but I don't know for sure.

So, putting it all together, I think that in the wild, hippos are only found in Africa. They might be in zoos elsewhere, but not in the wild. So the answer would be yes, you can only see wild hippopotamuses in Africa.
</think>

Hippopotamuses are semi-aquatic mammals native to Africa, where they inhabit rivers and lakes. While they are found in zoos worldwide, they are only present in the wild in Africa. Despite historical reports and myths about their presence elsewhere, there are no confirmed wild populations outside of Africa. Therefore, the answer is yes, you can only see wild hippopotamuses in Africa.

<answer>yes</answer>
